title: Isolating the variable
text: The first step is to move all the terms with a variable to one side and all the constants to the other. To do this, we can subtract 0.6x and 0.4 from both sides, which gives us the equation $$0.1x=2$$.

title: Clearing the decimal
text: To clear the decimal, multiply both sides of the equation by some factor of 10. In this case, we can mulitply the equation by 10.

title: Equation Without Decimals
text: Multiplying both sides of the equation by 10, we get $$10\times0.1x=10\times2$$, which simplifies to $$x=20$$.
